summary: American Indians and Alaska Natives die at higher rates than other Americans from preventable causes—such as diabetes and influenza. The Indian Health Service is charged with providing health care to these populations, but we found it had limited, inconsistent oversight over the quality of care at its facilities. Among other things, a lack of agency-wide performance standards and significant leadership turnover affected its oversight of...
title: Indian Health Service: Actions Needed to Improve Oversight of Quality of Care
